# gestureRecognizer(_:shouldReceive:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a touch or press event.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func gestureRecognizer(_ gestureRecognizer: UIGestureRecognizer, shouldReceive event: UIEvent) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **gestureRecognizer**: An instance of a subclass of the abstract base class [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizer].
- **event**: A [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIEvent] object from the current press or touch sequence.

## Return Value

Return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] to prevent the gesture recognizer from seeing this event.

## Discussion

UIKit calls this method once before either the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizerDelegate/gestureRecognizer(_:shouldReceive:)-73vzu] method or the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizerDelegate/gestureRecognizer(_:shouldReceive:)-16fuh] method of the gesture recognizer.

## Regulating gesture recognition

- **gestureRecognizerShouldBegin(_:)**: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should begin interpreting touches.
- **gestureRecognizer(_:shouldReceive:)**: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a touch.
- **gestureRecognizer(_:shouldReceive:)**: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a press.
